meanings.definition: The collection and transmission of data from remote sources.
meanings.sent1: The telemetries from the weather station help predict storms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use telemetries to study animal migration patterns.
meanings.sent3: The telemetries from the spaceship showed an alien dance party on Mars!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like telemetries, constantly observing and transmitting information.
meanings.sent5: The telemetries of the forest whispered secrets of its inhabitants.

meanings.definition: The process of monitoring and recording data from a distance.
meanings.sent1: Telemetries allow us to track the movement of endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The astronauts rely on telemetries to stay connected with mission control.
meanings.sent3: The telemetries revealed that the cat was secretly plotting to take over the world.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like telemetries, constantly checking for any irregularities.
meanings.sent5: The telemetries of the ocean waves painted a picture of distant lands.
